page.title: 03FARMING - DERWENT VALLEY
page.content: Hay is also fed to lambs, calves and hens. The surplus is sold as animal food. The land is divided into parts; one third arable, one third for cultivation and one third for grazing. Various types of machinery are used a tractor,plough, discs, harrows,drill and corndrill to plant corn. For hay, chain harrows, roller, reaper or mower, hayturner, bale sledge, bale transporter and a trailer with sides are used. The farm does not possess a combine harvester so they hire one. A combine costs between Â£20000 to Â£40000 The farmer rises at 6-6:15am and goes to bed around 11:00pm. In summer he finishes around 9:00pm but in winter, around 5 - 6:00pm. There are many jobs to do on the farm; hoeing turnips, field work, hedging, ditching, fencing, cutting weeds, milking goats and feeding animals.
